title: The Voice
body:
This happened back in the 1980's. I was 15 years old and there was a big rock concert in town that night. All of my friends were going, but I couldn't go because I couldn't afford a ticket. I lived not far from where the concert was taking place, and from my front porch I could faintly hear the music and singing.

I was sad that I couldn't be there, and I knew that everyone would be talking about it at school the next day. All I'd be able to talk about was hearing the music from my front porch.

Back during the 1980's I'd collect old pop bottles because you could trade them in at the store for a nickle each, and I had saved a lot of bottles. I put them into a plastic bag and decided to go and cash them in and then use the money to play games at an arcade that wasn't far from where I lived.

When I headed out to the store it was already dark outside, but that didn't concern me because I had walked to the store plenty of other times after dark.

I took my usual route to the store. At the end of the block that I lived on there was an alley way that I always cut through and as I approached the alley and was ready to walk into it, I clearly heard stern a voice that said. "Cross over to the sidewalk, do not go that way." I stopped in my tracks and looked around thinking that there was a person near me telling me not to go that way. However, as I looked around there was nobody there at all. The street was completely quiet and there was only one house about 50 feet away that had a porch light turned on.

So, I thought I'd do the smart thing and not take my usual shortcut. I crossed over to the other side of the sidewalk and just as i stepped onto the sidewalk I saw car lights go on in the alley. It shocked me because there was someone waiting in the alley for me, and the person must have known that I often walked that way.

I continued walking and the car pulled out of the alley and slowly drove along the side of the road where I was walking. The man in the car asked me, "do you want a ride." I replied with a simple, "no." He continued. "hop in the car and I'll take you anywhere you want to go." I looked at him and lied, "No thanks, I'm meeting a friend, I think I see him now," and I pointed ahead pretending like I could see someone down the road. At this point the man became very angry and started cussing at me. "Get into this car right now. If I have to come out and get you it's going to be a lot worse for you."

At this point I didn't look at him again, I just kept walking. Then I heard the voice again. This time the voice had a very serious tone to it, "Run!," "He's going to kill you." That's when I heard his car stop, and his car door open. He was suddenly running toward me saying, "You should have listened to me, now you're dead girl."

I dropped all of the bottles I was carrying and they shattered on the ground as I ran toward the only house that had a porch light on. I got up on the porch and the front door was open but there was a screen door. I could still hear the man behind me and I wasn't about to stop to knock. I opened the screen door and I ran inside the house. Once inside, there was an elderly woman sitting in a rocking chair. She didn't get up, she just pointed a walking cane at me and started cussing like a sailor. "Get out of my house." I looked at her and told her that there was a man chasing me." She continued to protest that I had run right into her house without knocking, as I turned to look out of the screen door to see if he was there. I only saw the tail lights of his car speeding away.

I turned and looked at the elderly woman and I told her that I was sorry for just running into her home. I asked her if she wanted me to lock the door on my way out. She nodded yes, and so I did.

For whatever reason, I wasn't scared or worried that the man was going to return. I was mad because I'd broken all of my bottles and so the only thing to do was head back home.

That was the first time, and the last time I ever heard a voice warning me of impending danger. I have no idea what, or who it was. A guardian angel? A ghost?

I guess it doesn't matter, I'm thankful that i heard it that night.
author: donefinishedover
